definitions: constituting number one thousand in a sequence or series of items
examples: She finished in thousandth place among all marathon runners
This is the thousandth time I've heard that song today

definitions: having a spiral ridge cut around the inside or outside for screwing
passed through or woven between other things like thread through fabric
examples: The threaded bolt secured the metal plates together
We need threaded pipe fittings for this plumbing job
Her hair was threaded with silver strands of gray
The narrow path threaded between ancient oak trees

definitions: facing the possibility of trouble, danger, or ruin in the near future
at risk of extinction but not yet classified as endangered by conservation standards
examples: The threatened business needed emergency funding to survive
Residents felt threatened by the approaching wildfire
The threatened butterfly species requires immediate habitat protection
Several threatened plant species grow only in this rainforest

definitions: showing intention to inflict harm, injury, or other hostile action on someone
having a frightening, ominous, or menacing quality or appearance in weather or situations
examples: His threatening words made everyone in the room uncomfortable
The letter contained threatening language about legal action
Dark threatening clouds gathered before the severe storm arrived
The threatening atmosphere made us leave the protest early

definitions: being one more than two in number or quantity
examples: The three children played together in the backyard
She ordered three cups of coffee for her guests

definitions: three times as great or as numerous in amount or degree
consisting of three parts, elements, or aspects combined together as one
examples: Sales showed a threefold increase after the marketing campaign
The medicine produced a threefold improvement in patient outcomes
The threefold approach addressed education, healthcare, and economic development
Their threefold strategy involved research, testing, and implementation phases

definitions: using money and other resources carefully and not wastefully
examples: My thrifty grandmother saved money by growing her own vegetables
Thrifty shoppers always compare prices before making purchases

definitions: feeling sudden intense excitement, pleasure, or enthusiasm about something
examples: She was thrilled to receive the job offer yesterday
The children were thrilled about their trip to the amusement park

definitions: producing a sudden feeling of excitement, pleasure, or suspense in someone
examples: The thrilling roller coaster ride left everyone breathless with excitement
Reading that thrilling mystery novel kept me awake all night

definitions: prospering, flourishing, or developing well and vigorously in favorable conditions
examples: The thriving business expanded to three new locations this year
Her thriving garden produced vegetables throughout the entire summer season

definitions: having a throat of a particular color, type, or appearance
examples: The ruby-throated hummingbird visited our feeder every morning
White-throated sparrows sang their distinctive songs at dawn

definitions: beating or pounding with a strong, regular rhythm, especially painfully
examples: His throbbing headache made it impossible to concentrate on work
The throbbing music from the nightclub kept neighbors awake

definitions: designed to be used once and then thrown away after use
said or written casually without careful thought or emphasis on importance
examples: The restaurant switched from throwaway plastic cups to reusable glasses
We live in a throwaway society that creates too much waste
Her throwaway comment about the weather sparked an unexpected conversation
The actor delivered the throwaway line with perfect comedic timing

definitions: characteristic of an earlier time or reviving something from the past
examples: The diner's throwback decor featured 1950s music and vintage posters
His throwback fashion style included bell-bottom jeans and platform shoes

definitions: having been sent through the air by force of arm or machine
put into a state of confusion, surprise, or being emotionally unsettled
examples: The thrown ball sailed over the fence into the neighbor's yard
Stones thrown at the window broke the glass completely
She was completely thrown by the unexpected question during her interview
The sudden change in plans had thrown everyone into confusion

definitions: making a heavy, dull sound like something large hitting a surface repeatedly
very large, impressive, or emphatic in size, amount, or degree
examples: The thumping bass from the party could be heard next door
His thumping footsteps on the stairs woke the whole house
The company reported a thumping profit increase this quarter
She won by a thumping majority in the election

definitions: producing a loud, deep, rumbling sound like thunder or heavy impacts
very great in degree, amount, or intensity, used for emphasis
examples: The thundering waterfall could be heard from miles away
Thundering hooves announced the arrival of the cavalry
The movie was a thundering success at the box office
His speech was met with thundering applause from the audience

definitions: making a loud, deep, prolonged sound resembling thunder in volume or intensity
examples: The thunderous applause lasted for several minutes after her performance
A thunderous explosion shook the entire neighborhood last night

definitions: prevented from accomplishing something or stopped from achieving a purpose or plan
examples: Their thwarted attempt to climb the mountain ended in disappointment
The thwarted robbery suspect was caught by security guards

definitions: actively preventing someone from accomplishing something or blocking the achievement of goals
examples: The thwarting regulations made business expansion nearly impossible
Her thwarting behavior prevented the team from reaching consensus

definitions: relating to or affecting the thyroid gland in the neck that produces hormones
examples: The doctor ordered thyroid tests to check hormone levels
Thyroid medication helped regulate her metabolism and energy levels

definitions: relating to or affected by tides caused by gravitational pull on oceans
examples: The tidal pools were full of colorful sea creatures at low tide
Tidal energy could provide clean renewable power for coastal communities

definitions: arranged neatly and in order with everything in its proper place
fairly large or considerable in amount, number, or extent
examples: She keeps her desk tidy with labeled folders and organizers
The tidy garden had perfectly trimmed hedges and weeded flowerbeds
They made a tidy profit from selling their old house
He inherited a tidy sum from his wealthy uncle

definitions: fastened or bound with string, rope, or similar material into a knot
having the same score or ranking as another competitor in a contest
examples: The tied packages were ready for shipping to customers
Her tied shoelaces came undone during the race
The tied game went into overtime to determine the winner
Both candidates were tied in the latest opinion polls

definitions: having a series of rows or levels placed one above the other
examples: The tiered wedding cake had five beautifully decorated layers
The tiered seating in the amphitheater provided excellent views

definitions: covered or decorated with thin flat pieces of baked clay or other material
examples: The tiled bathroom floor was easy to clean and maintain
Beautiful tiled roofs are common in Mediterranean style architecture

definitions: having soil that has been turned over and broken up for cultivation
examples: The freshly tilled fields were ready for spring planting season
Tilled soil provides better conditions for seed germination

definitions: moved or positioned so as to lean or incline from vertical or horizontal
examples: The tilted picture frame needed to be straightened on the wall
She wore her hat at a tilted angle for a stylish look

meanings: made of or covered with wood
definitions: constructed with exposed wooden beams or having areas covered with trees for timber
examples: The timbered cottage had beautiful exposed oak beams throughout
Heavily timbered mountains provided lumber for the growing town

definitions: measured, recorded, or regulated according to time taken or a schedule
set to occur or operate at a particular time or after a time interval
examples: The timed test gave students exactly one hour to complete
His perfectly timed arrival surprised everyone at the party
The timed sprinkler system waters the lawn every morning at six
Timed medications must be taken at specific intervals daily

definitions: not affected by the passage of time or changes in fashion, remaining eternally relevant
examples: Her timeless beauty was evident in photographs from every decade
Classical music has a timeless quality that appeals to all generations

definitions: done or occurring at a favorable or useful time, especially opportune or appropriate
examples: Your timely intervention prevented a serious accident from happening
The timely rain saved the drought-stricken crops from failure

definitions: showing a lack of courage or confidence, easily frightened or shy
examples: The timid child hid behind her mother when strangers approached
His timid nature prevented him from speaking up in meetings

definitions: causing or feeling a slight prickling or stinging sensation on skin or body
examples: The tingling sensation in her fingers indicated poor circulation
Tingling excitement filled the air before the big announcement

definitions: preserved and sealed in airtight metal cans for long-term storage
covered with a thin layer of tin metal for protection against corrosion
examples: Tinned vegetables can last for years in the pantry
British people often prefer tinned beans on toast for breakfast
The tinned copper wires resisted corrosion in marine environments
Tinned steel is commonly used in food packaging applications

definitions: having an end or extremity of a specified kind or material
leaning to one side or turned over from an upright position
examples: The arrow had a steel-tipped point for better penetration
She used a felt-tipped pen to write the thank-you notes
The tipped vase spilled water all over the table
Several tipped garbage cans littered the alley after the storm

definitions: slightly drunk or intoxicated but not completely impaired by alcohol
examples: After two glasses of wine, she felt pleasantly tipsy
His tipsy behavior at the party amused everyone there

definitions: having or showing great effort or energy without becoming tired or giving up
examples: The tireless volunteers worked through the night distributing emergency supplies
Her tireless dedication to the cause inspired others to join

definitions: causing one to feel bored, annoyed, or impatient through being tedious or repetitive
examples: The tiresome commute takes two hours each way every day
His tiresome complaints about the weather annoyed his coworkers

definitions: causing one to need rest or sleep through physical or mental effort required
examples: The tiring hike up the mountain took six hours to complete
Working double shifts was tiring but necessary to pay bills

definitions: of exceptional strength, size, or power like the mythological Titans
examples: Their titanic struggle for civil rights changed the nation forever
The titanic waves crashed against the coastal cliffs during storms

definitions: having a title of nobility or an official designation of rank or status
examples: The titled aristocrat owned several estates throughout the country
Her newly titled position came with increased responsibilities

definitions: holding a purely formal position or title without any real authority
denoting the person or thing from which a work takes its title
examples: The king was merely a titular ruler with no real power
The titular head of the organization rarely attended meetings
The titular character of Hamlet appears in most scenes
Emma is the titular heroine of Jane Austen's novel

definitions: browned, crisped, or dried by exposure to radiant heat
examples: The toasted bread had a perfect golden-brown color
Toasted almonds added extra flavor to the salad

definitions: having toes of a specified kind, number, or position
examples: The three-toed sloth moves slowly through the rainforest canopy
Steel-toed boots are required in the construction area

definitions: done for the sake of appearances or as a symbolic gesture only
examples: The company made only token efforts to increase diversity
His token resistance to the plan was quickly overcome

definitions: able to be endured or accepted, though not necessarily pleasant or desirable
examples: The pain was barely tolerable even with strong medication
Living conditions in the refugee camp were just tolerable

definitions: showing willingness to allow or accept behavior and opinions different from one's own
examples: The tolerant community welcomed people from all backgrounds and beliefs
Parents should be tolerant of their children's mistakes while learning

definitions: relating to the tone or tones of music, color, or vocal sound
examples: The tonal qualities of the violin were exceptionally rich
Tonal variations in her voice conveyed different emotions

definitions: having firm and well-defined muscles from regular exercise
having a particular quality of sound or color tone
examples: Her toned arms showed the results of months at the gym
The athlete's toned physique impressed everyone at the competition
The sepia-toned photographs gave a vintage feel to the album
Softly toned colors created a peaceful atmosphere in the room
